element_scores.name: Dataset Discovery and Identification
element_scores.description: Can a user or system discover and uniquely identify this dataset?

sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://fairhub.io/datasets/2
sub_elements.quality_note: URI present as persistent identifier. While not a DOI, it's a stable identifier on a recognized platform (FAIRhub). No separate DOI or RRID field populated.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: URI format valid - FAIRhub platform identifier

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness
sub_elements.evidence: title: Artificial Intelligence Ready and Equitable Atlas for Diabetes Insights (AI-READI); description: 500+ character comprehensive multi-paragraph description covering cohort size (4,000 individuals), multimodal data types, multi-site design, diabetes focus, sampling strategy, FAIR compliance
sub_elements.quality_note: Excellent title with full acronym expansion and clear descriptive phrase. Description is comprehensive, covering study population, data modalities, methodological approach, scientific goals (salutogenesis), and principles (FAIR, ethical).
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Title and description are detailed and informative

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.evidence: keywords: 22 entries including 'Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus', 'T2DM', 'AI-READI', 'Machine Learning', 'Artificial Intelligence', 'multimodal dataset', 'harmonized data', 'multi-site study', 'salutogenesis', 'FAIR principles', 'retinal imaging', 'continuous glucose monitoring', 'wearable devices', 'biorepository', 'biospecimens', 'triple-balanced sampling', 'health equity', 'Bridge2AI', 'cross-sectional study'
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive keyword list covering disease domain (T2DM), AI/ML methods, data types, design features, ethical principles, and program affiliation
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Keywords cover multiple dimensions - medical domain, technical methods, study design, ethical principles

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://fairhub.io/datasets/2; external_resources: 9 entries including project website, documentation, dataset repository, funding, publications
sub_elements.quality_note: Landing page URL provided; no hierarchical resources field but external_resources provides comprehensive ecosystem links
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Landing page present; hierarchical resources structure not used but external_resources extensive

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.evidence: No parent_datasets or related_datasets fields found
sub_elements.quality_note: Missing hierarchical structure fields - dataset appears standalone without explicit parent/child relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Schema fields parent_datasets and related_datasets not populated

element_scores.name: Dataset Access and Retrieval
element_scores.description: Can the dataset and its associated resources be located, accessed, and downloaded?

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: Creative Commons Attribution Non-Commercial (CC BY-NC 4.0) with detailed description and license_terms list covering proper citation, non-commercial use, derivative works permitted with attribution, changes must be indicated, controlled access requires separate agreement; ip_restrictions field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive license documentation with both human-readable description and structured license_terms. Two-tier access model (public CC BY-NC, controlled access with DUA) clearly described. IP restrictions not in separate field.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License terms comprehensive but ip_restrictions field missing

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.evidence: No regulatory_restrictions or confidentiality_level fields found; controlled access mentioned for sensitive data (genomic, 5-digit zip code, medical records) in subsets
sub_elements.quality_note: Regulatory frameworks implied (genomic data, medical records require controlled access) but regulatory_restrictions and confidentiality_level schema fields not populated
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Regulatory info present in narrative (subsets descriptions) but not in structured fields

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats entries include access_urls: https://fairhub.io/datasets/2 for multiple formats; page field also points to same URL
sub_elements.quality_note: FAIRhub access URLs provided in distribution_formats and page field; download_url top-level field not used but access URLs present in format-specific entries
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Access URLs present in distribution formats

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats: 4 entries (DICOM for imaging, CSV for tabular/time-series, mHealth standard for wearable data, REDCap data dictionary)
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple distribution formats clearly specified with format names, descriptions, and access URLs. Covers major data modalities (imaging, tabular, wearable).
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Distribution formats comprehensive and well-documented

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 9 entries including project website (aireadi.org), documentation (docs.aireadi.org), FAIRhub dataset page, Bridge2AI program, NIH RePORTER, data sharing info, Zenodo archive, BMJ Open protocol publication, Nature Metabolism commentary; related_datasets field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive external resources covering documentation, repositories, funding, publications, and parent program; no typed relationships to related datasets
sub_elements.semantic_validation: External resources present; related_datasets field not used

element_scores.name: Data Reuse and Interoperability
element_scores.description: Is sufficient information provided to reuse and integrate the dataset with others?

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: CC BY-NC 4.0 explicitly permits distribution, remix, adaptation, building upon work non-commercially, derivative works on different terms with attribution
sub_elements.quality_note: License explicitly supports research reuse with clear attribution requirements and permissive derivative work policies for non-commercial use
sub_elements.semantic_validation: License permits research use and reuse with appropriate safeguards

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats specify DICOM (imaging), CSV (tabular), mHealth standard (wearable); preprocessing_strategies mention OMOP Common Data Model, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10; format/encoding top-level fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Standard formats (DICOM, CSV, mHealth) and data standards (OMOP CDM, RxNorm, ICD-10) documented in distribution and preprocessing. Top-level format/encoding fields not used.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Formats standardized and mapped to clinical data standards but not in top-level format/encoding fields

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies mention OMOP Common Data Model, DICOM format, mHealth standard, RxNorm codes, ICD-10 codes; conforms_to or conforms_to_schema fields not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple standards mentioned (OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10) in preprocessing documentation but conforms_to/conforms_to_schema fields not populated
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Standards conformance documented in preprocessing but schema conformance fields not used

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.evidence: No variables field (as schema list) populated; data dictionaries mentioned (REDCap data dictionary) in distribution_formats but not structured variable-level metadata
sub_elements.quality_note: Data dictionary availability mentioned (REDCap) but variables schema field not populated with structured metadata and identifiers
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable documentation exists in external dictionaries but variables field not populated

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.evidence: intended_uses: 5 entries (AI/ML model development for T2DM, multi-modal T2DM research, health equity research, biomarker discovery, model dataset for AI-ready standards); discouraged_uses: 3 entries (uses during ongoing enrollment, clinical decision-making without validation, re-identification attempts); prohibited_uses field not present
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive use guidance with detailed intended uses and discouraged uses; prohibited_uses field not used but discouraged_uses includes re-identification prohibition
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Use guidance comprehensive covering recommendations and warnings

element_scores.name: Ethical Use and Privacy Safeguards
element_scores.description: Does the dataset provide clear information about consent, privacy, and ethical oversight?

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: University of Washington IRB approval number STUDY00016228 with reliance agreements from UAB and UCSD IRBs; written informed consent; bioethics guidance integrated; Community Advisory Board with 11 diverse members; ethical_reviews as list field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive IRB documentation with approval number, reliance agreements, consent process, bioethics integration, and community engagement. Ethics review documented in human_subject_research class but not in ethical_reviews list.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Ethics review extensively documented but in different field structure

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.evidence: subsets describe de-identified public access dataset vs controlled access with sensitive identifiers (5-digit zip code, race, ethnicity, sex, genetic data, medical records); is_deidentified field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: De-identification strategy documented through two-tier access model (public de-identified, controlled access with identifiers); is_deidentified class field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: De-identification documented in subsets descriptions; is_deidentified field not populated

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.evidence: Two-tier access (public vs controlled with DUA); biospecimen access policies under development; Data Access Committee established; finite biospecimen distribution; participant_privacy field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Multiple privacy layers: public/controlled access tiers, data use agreements, Data Access Committee oversight, biospecimen access controls. Documented in subsets/updates but not in participant_privacy schema field.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Privacy protections extensive but not in structured participant_privacy field

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research: 'Written informed consent provided by all participants'
sub_elements.quality_note: Informed consent documented in human_subject_research but not in informed_consent list field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Consent documented in human_subject_research narrative

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research mentions recruitment targeted to racial/ethnic minorities disproportionately affected by T2DM (Asian, Black, Hispanic populations); tribal consultation planned for Native American cohort; vulnerable_populations and participant_compensation fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Vulnerable/special populations acknowledged (racial/ethnic minorities, planned tribal consultation) in human_subject_research; schema fields not used; compensation not documented
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Vulnerable populations mentioned but not in dedicated schema fields; compensation not documented

element_scores.name: Data Composition and Structure
element_scores.description: Can the dataset's structure, modality, and population be understood from metadata?

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.evidence: subpopulations: 8 entries (4 race/ethnicity groups: Asian, Black, Hispanic, White; 4 diabetes severity groups: no diabetes, pre-diabetes/lifestyle-controlled, medication-controlled, insulin-controlled) each with target ~1,000 participants (25% of sample)
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive subpopulation characterization with triple-balanced design across race/ethnicity, sex, and diabetes severity. Clear target proportions for equity.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Subpopulations well-defined with clinical and demographic dimensions

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_elements.evidence: instances: Target enrollment 4,000 individuals aged 40+ with and without T2DM, triple-balanced by race/ethnicity, diabetes severity, and biological sex; enrollment began July 18, 2023 and continues until November 30, 2026
sub_elements.quality_note: Clear instance count (4,000 target) with eligibility criteria, enrollment timeline, and sampling design
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Instance counts and enrollment details clearly stated

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.evidence: REDCap data dictionary mentioned in distribution_formats; multimodal data domains described (survey, clinical measurements, retinal imaging, visual function, lab tests, ECG, cognitive function, peripheral neuropathy, glucose monitoring, physical activity, environmental monitoring, biospecimens); variables and is_tabular fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Variable-level metadata available via REDCap data dictionary; data modalities comprehensively described in acquisition_methods (12 methods); schema fields not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Variable metadata available externally; schema fields not used

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.evidence: instances and purposes describe T2DM focus with four diabetes severity levels (no diabetes, pre-diabetes/lifestyle-controlled, medication-controlled, insulin-controlled); salutogenesis pathway research; multi-domain data (survey, clinical, imaging, wearable, environmental, biospecimen)
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive description of clinical conditions (diabetes spectrum), data topics (salutogenesis), and data domains covered
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Data topics clearly enumerated across multiple fields

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_elements.evidence: sampling_strategies: triple-balanced recruitment with is_sample: true, is_random: false, is_representative: false; wave-based recruitment with monitoring and adjustment; anomalies field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Sampling characteristics clearly documented with quality flags (not random, not representative); quality control measures in preprocessing_strategies (training, calibration, duplicate measurements, validation checks); anomalies field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Sampling documented with quality flags; anomalies field missing but quality control documented

element_scores.name: Data Provenance and Version Tracking
element_scores.description: Can a user determine dataset versions, update history, and provenance?

sub_elements.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates mentions 'Pilot data released May 2024; all data through July 31, 2024 released November 2024' and 'v1.0.0 data through July 31, 2024 released November 2024', 'v2.0.0 and v3.0.0 released with additional participants'; version field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Version numbers documented in updates narrative (v1.0.0, v2.0.0, v3.0.0) with release dates but not in version schema field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Versions documented in updates but version field not used

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented
sub_elements.evidence: updates mentions 'Version-specific documentation maintained for each release' at https://docs.aireadi.org/; access via FAIRhub at https://fairhub.io/datasets/2; version_access field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Version access via FAIRhub and version-specific documentation documented in updates; version_access class field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Version access mentioned but not in structured field

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates.update_details: 'Periodic data releases as enrollment continues', 'Pilot data released May 2024', 'v1.0.0 data through July 31, 2024 released November 2024', 'v2.0.0 and v3.0.0 released with additional participants', 'Final dataset expected after completion of 4,000 participant enrollment by November 2026', 'Dataset versioning implemented', 'Version-specific documentation at https://docs.aireadi.org/'; errata field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Version changes documented in updates with release history and future roadmap; errata field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Change documentation in updates; errata field missing

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_elements.evidence: updates.frequency: 'Periodic releases with ongoing enrollment; final release planned for late 2026'
sub_elements.quality_note: Update frequency (periodic) and timeline (through November 2026) clearly stated with enrollment-driven releases
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Update schedule documented with project end date

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: D4D header comments: 'Source: data/preprocessed/concatenated/AI_READI_preprocessed.txt (245K, 13 source files)'; collection_mechanisms describe data sources (EHR screening, multi-site collection, wearable monitoring, biobanking); was_derived_from and release_notes fields not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Generation provenance in D4D header; data collection provenance in collection_mechanisms (EHR sources, multi-site protocols); schema provenance fields not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Provenance in metadata header and collection descriptions but not in schema fields

element_scores.name: Scientific Motivation and Funding Transparency
element_scores.description: Does the metadata clearly state why the dataset exists and who funded it?

sub_elements.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation
sub_elements.evidence: purposes: 3 detailed entries (Understanding T2DM salutogenesis with hypothesis-agnostic harmonized multi-domain dataset for AI/ML; Establishing AI/ML data standards and best practices with FAIR adherence and bioethics guidance; Addressing demographic inequities through triple-balanced recruitment)
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive purpose statements covering scientific goals (salutogenesis), methodological goals (standards establishment), and equity goals (demographic diversity)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Purpose clearly articulated across multiple perspectives

sub_elements.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks
sub_elements.evidence: tasks: 3 entries (Enable multi-domain AI/ML analyses for T2DM across survey, clinical, imaging, wearable, environmental, biospecimen domains; Develop unbiased AI/ML models through balanced data collection; Study T2DM disease trajectories and salutogenesis pathways via pseudotime manifold analysis)
sub_elements.quality_note: Detailed task descriptions aligned with purposes, covering multimodal analysis, bias mitigation, and disease trajectory modeling
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Tasks comprehensive and aligned with purposes

sub_elements.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_elements.evidence: funders: NIH Common Fund Bridge2AI Program with detailed description including administering agency (NIH Office of the Director) and additional support sources (P30DK035816, UL1TR003096, Research to Prevent Blindness)
sub_elements.quality_note: Primary funding source (NIH Bridge2AI) and supplementary sources identified with agencies and programs
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Funding sources clearly documented

sub_elements.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_elements.evidence: funders description includes 'National Institutes of Health grant OT2OD032644', 'Total funding in 2022: $5,026,499', 'Opportunity Number: OTA-21-008', 'Project dates: September 1, 2022 to August 31, 2025', additional grants 'P30DK035816 (Nutrition and Obesity Research Center), UL1TR003096'
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive grant information: primary grant number (OT2OD032644), opportunity number (OTA-21-008), funding amount ($5,026,499 in 2022), project dates (Sept 2022 - Aug 2025), and supplementary grants
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Grant identifiers complete and traceable with funding details

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented
sub_elements.evidence: creators: 20 entries including Contact PI/Project Leader (Aaron Lee, University of Washington), Principal Investigator (Cynthia Owsley, UAB), and 18 Co-Investigators with affiliations and departments
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive creator list with roles (Contact PI, PI, Co-I), names, affiliations, and departments/units
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Creator attribution complete and detailed

element_scores.name: Technical Transparency (Data Collection and Processing)
element_scores.description: Can data collection and processing steps be replicated or understood?

sub_elements.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_elements.evidence: collection_mechanisms: 5 entries (In-person data collection visits at 3 sites with 2.5-4 hour multi-domain protocol; EHR screening for source population with ICD-10 codes; Wave-based recruitment with balance monitoring; Home-based wearable monitoring for 10 days; Biospecimen collection and biobanking at UAB CCTS)
sub_elements.quality_note: Collection mechanisms comprehensively documented with settings (multi-site, in-person, home-based), duration (single visit, 10-day monitoring), and protocols (standardized, wave-based)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Collection process replicable from documentation

sub_elements.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_elements.evidence: acquisition_methods: 12 entries covering survey/questionnaire data (REDCap with multiple instruments), physical measurements (anthropometry, vital signs), retinal imaging (multi-device protocol with 7 instruments), visual function testing (acuity, contrast sensitivity, autorefraction), clinical lab testing (CBC, plasma, serum, whole blood, urine at CLIA-certified and central labs), ECG (12-lead Philips), cognitive function (MoCA), peripheral neuropathy (monofilament), continuous glucose monitoring (Dexcom G6), physical activity monitoring (Garmin VivoSmart 5), environmental monitoring (custom sensor), biospecimen collection (blood, urine, processing, storage)
sub_elements.quality_note: All acquisition modalities documented with specific instruments, protocols, and data types. Exceptionally detailed technical specifications.
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Acquisition methods thorough, multimodal, and instrument-specific

sub_elements.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies
sub_elements.evidence: preprocessing_strategies: 5 entries (Data standardization and harmonization across 3 sites with REDCap, SOPs, training; Image format conversion from proprietary to DICOM and .FIT to mHealth; Biospecimen processing with standardized and centralized protocols; Quality control with training certification, calibration, duplicate measurements, validation; Data mapping to OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10); cleaning_strategies: 1 entry (Multi-site harmonization with standardized protocols, equipment, training, REDCap, FAIR compliance); labeling_strategies field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive preprocessing (format conversion, harmonization, QC, standards mapping) and cleaning (multi-site standardization) documented; labeling strategies not applicable/documented for this observational dataset
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Preprocessing and cleaning comprehensive; labeling not applicable for observational data

sub_elements.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Acquisition methods mention specific instruments and software: REDCap (data management, surveys), M&S Technology Electronic Visual Acuity tester, Topcon KR 800 (autorefraction), Philips Pagewriter TC30, MoCA Duo Application (iPad), Dexcom G6, Garmin VivoSmart 5, custom environmental sensor; Imaging devices: Aurora IQ (Optomed), EIDON (iCare), Spectralis HRA OCT (Heidelberg), Maestro2 3D OCT-1 (Topcon), Triton DRI OCT (Topcon), Cirrus 5000 (Zeiss), FLIO (Heidelberg); software_and_tools field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Major hardware and software tools documented in acquisition/preprocessing narratives (REDCap, imaging devices, clinical instruments, wearables) but not in software_and_tools schema field
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Software/hardware documented in narratives; schema field not used

sub_elements.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 9 entries (project website, documentation, FAIRhub, Bridge2AI, NIH RePORTER, data sharing, Zenodo, BMJ Open, Nature Metabolism); preprocessing mentions standards (OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10); FAIR principles in keywords and description; conforms_to field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: External resources and standards referenced extensively (OMOP, DICOM, mHealth, FAIR principles); conforms_to field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Standards and resources documented; conforms_to field missing

element_scores.name: Dataset Evaluation and Limitations Disclosure
element_scores.description: Does the metadata communicate known risks, biases, or dataset limitations?

sub_elements.name: Known Limitations Documented
sub_elements.evidence: No known_limitations field; discouraged_uses mentions 'ongoing enrollment may not have achieved balanced distribution' and 'pilot data releases and periodic updates limitation', but no systematic limitations documentation
sub_elements.quality_note: Enrollment status limitations implied in discouraged_uses but no explicit known_limitations field documenting sampling, generalizability, or methodological limitations
sub_elements.semantic_validation: known_limitations field not populated

sub_elements.name: Systematic Biases Identified and Described
sub_elements.evidence: No known_biases field; addressing_gaps mentions historical demographic inequities in T2DM research (lack of diversity) as gap being addressed, but no systematic bias documentation for this dataset
sub_elements.quality_note: Historical bias issues mentioned in gaps (prior research lacked diversity) but no systematic bias documentation for AI-READI dataset itself (e.g., selection bias from targeted recruitment, exclusion of non-English speakers)
sub_elements.semantic_validation: known_biases field not populated

sub_elements.name: Data Anomalies and Quality Issues Noted
sub_elements.evidence: No anomalies field found; quality control measures documented in preprocessing_strategies but no anomaly reporting
sub_elements.quality_note: Quality control measures documented (training, calibration, validation) but no anomalies field documenting quality issues encountered
sub_elements.semantic_validation: anomalies field not populated

sub_elements.name: Sensitive Content and Warnings Provided
sub_elements.evidence: sensitive_elements: 3 entries (Genetic and biospecimen data with genomic DNA, blood derivatives, urine, PBMCs, PAXgene RNA in controlled access; Geographic and demographic identifiers with 5-digit zip code, race, ethnicity, sex in controlled access; Medical history and records with past health records, medications, traffic/accident reports in controlled access); content_warnings field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Comprehensive sensitive element documentation with three categories and controlled access requirements; content_warnings field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Sensitive elements well-documented; content warnings field missing

sub_elements.name: Ethical Review Details Including Conflicts
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research documents IRB approval (UW STUDY00016228, UAB and UCSD reliance agreements), written informed consent, bioethics integration, Community Advisory Board (11 diverse members), ethical and equitable practices; ethical_reviews as list field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Ethics review comprehensively documented in human_subject_research with IRB details, consent, community engagement; conflict disclosure not present; ethical_reviews list field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Ethics review present but not in ethical_reviews list field; conflicts not disclosed

element_scores.name: Cross-Platform and Community Integration
element_scores.description: Does the dataset connect to wider data ecosystems, repositories, or standards?

sub_elements.name: Dataset Published on a Recognized Platform
sub_elements.evidence: FAIRhub distribution documented in id, page, distribution_formats, external_resources; description mentions FAIRhub and FAIR principles; maintainer_details mention data coordination at University of Washington; publisher field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: FAIRhub platform extensively documented as distribution and hosting platform; publisher field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Platform documented but publisher field missing

sub_elements.name: Citation and DOI for Cross-referencing
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://fairhub.io/datasets/2 (not a DOI); external_resources include DOI links for publications (10.1136/bmjopen-2024-097449, 10.1038/s42255-024-01165-x) and Zenodo (10.5281/zenodo.10642459) but no dataset DOI; citation field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Dataset identifier is FAIRhub URL not DOI; publication DOIs present but dataset DOI missing; citation field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Dataset DOI missing; formatted citation field missing

sub_elements.name: Community Standards or Schema Conformance
sub_elements.evidence: FAIR principles in keywords and description; preprocessing mentions OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10; description mentions 'AI-ready' and adherence to FAIR principles; conforms_to field not populated
sub_elements.quality_note: Standards mentioned (FAIR principles, OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth) in keywords, description, and preprocessing; conforms_to field not used
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Standards referenced but conforms_to field missing

sub_elements.name: Outreach Materials and Documentation Links
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources: 9 entries (AI-READI Project Website https://aireadi.org/, Documentation https://docs.aireadi.org/, FAIRhub Dataset Landing Page https://fairhub.io/datasets/2, Bridge2AI Program https://bridge2ai.org/, NIH RePORTER https://reporter.nih.gov/project-details/10471118, Data Sharing https://aireadi.org/goals/data-sharing, Zenodo https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.10642459, BMJ Open protocol, Nature Metabolism commentary); page field present
sub_elements.quality_note: Extensive outreach and documentation resources covering project site, documentation, repository, funding, publications, and parent program
sub_elements.semantic_validation: Documentation ecosystem comprehensive

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets with Typed Relationships
sub_elements.evidence: No related_datasets field found; external_resources includes Bridge2AI parent program but no explicit links to sibling datasets (VOICE, CM4AI, CHORUS)
sub_elements.quality_note: Missing typed relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets despite being part of Bridge2AI consortium
sub_elements.semantic_validation: related_datasets field not populated

issues_detected.description: Many optional schema fields not populated despite relevant information existing in other fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Consider populating optional schema fields to improve machine-readability and semantic interoperability

issues_detected.description: Important information often in narrative fields rather than structured schema fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Extract structured information from narratives into dedicated schema fields when available

issues_detected.description: Dataset limitations, biases, and anomalies not explicitly documented in schema fields
issues_detected.recommendation: Add explicit limitations documentation covering: (1) sampling bias (triple-balanced targeted recruitment vs random sampling, non-representative by design per sampling_strategies), (2) generalizability constraints (English-speaking only, age 40+, three US sites, exclusion of pregnant individuals and type 1 diabetes), (3) ongoing enrollment status (data released during collection may lack full balance), (4) cross-sectional design limitations for longitudinal disease progression analysis

issues_detected.description: Dataset lacks DOI persistent identifier; uses platform-specific FAIRhub URL instead
issues_detected.recommendation: Register DOI for dataset to enable persistent cross-referencing and citation tracking independent of platform

issues_detected.description: Standards conformance mentioned in narratives but not in structured conforms_to field
issues_detected.recommendation: Populate conforms_to field with URIs for FAIR principles, OMOP CDM, DICOM, mHealth, RxNorm, ICD-10

semantic_analysis.semantic_insights: AI-READI D4D datasheet demonstrates exceptional documentation comprehensiveness with detailed information across all major categories (motivation, composition, collection, preprocessing, ethics, distribution, maintenance). The dataset achieves 43/50 points (86%) primarily through rich narrative documentation of complex multimodal data collection from 4,000 participants across 3 sites with 12+ data acquisition modalities. Key strengths include: (1) Comprehensive ethics documentation (IRB approval with number, reliance agreements, informed consent, bioethics integration, Community Advisory Board), (2) Extensive technical transparency (12 acquisition methods with specific instruments, 5 preprocessing strategies including standards mapping to OMOP/DICOM/mHealth, multi-site harmonization protocols), (3) Strong equity focus (triple-balanced sampling across race/ethnicity, sex, diabetes severity; targeted recruitment of underrepresented groups), (4) Detailed versioning (v1.0.0, v2.0.0, v3.0.0 with release timeline through 2026), (5) Comprehensive funding/creator attribution (primary grant OT2OD032644 with opportunity number, funding amount, 20 creators with roles and affiliations). Primary opportunities for improvement: (1) Explicit limitations documentation (sampling bias from non-random targeted recruitment, generalizability constraints from eligibility criteria, ongoing enrollment status, cross-sectional design limitations), (2) DOI registration for persistent identification beyond platform-specific URL, (3) Structured schema field utilization (version, publisher, citation, conforms_to, variables, is_deidentified), (4) Typed dataset relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets (VOICE, CM4AI, CHORUS), (5) Participant compensation documentation. Notable technical sophistication: retinal imaging from 7 different devices with format standardization to DICOM, central laboratory processing at UW NORC, biorepository at UAB CCTS, wearable monitoring (Dexcom G6, Garmin VivoSmart 5), environmental sensors, genomic sequencing from buffy coats. Two-tier access model (public CC BY-NC for de-identified data, controlled access with DUA for sensitive identifiers/genomics) balances openness with privacy. Overall, this is a high-quality datasheet for a landmark flagship AI-ready dataset that prioritizes comprehensive narrative documentation over strict schema field coverage.

recommendations: Add known_limitations field documenting: (1) Sampling limitations: triple-balanced targeted recruitment (not random sampling), non-representative by design (sampling_strategies: is_representative: false), (2) Generalizability constraints: English-speaking only, age 40+ only, three US sites only (Birmingham AL, San Diego CA, Seattle WA), exclusion of pregnant individuals and type 1 diabetes, (3) Ongoing enrollment limitations: periodic data releases during enrollment may not have achieved balanced distribution across all groups (as noted in discouraged_uses), (4) Design limitations: cross-sectional study limits longitudinal disease progression analysis despite pseudotime manifold analysis goals
Register DOI for dataset to enable persistent cross-referencing independent of FAIRhub platform; update id and doi fields accordingly

Add known_biases field documenting potential biases: (1) Selection bias from targeted recruitment (not random), (2) Language bias (English-speaking only excludes non-English speakers in diverse populations), (3) Age bias (40+ only excludes younger onset T2DM), (4) Health system bias (recruitment from EHR at 3 academic medical centers may not represent those without regular healthcare access), (5) Participation bias (volunteers for 2.5-4 hour visit plus 10-day monitoring may differ from general population)
Populate version field with current version number (e.g., 'v3.0.0' based on updates narrative)
Add publisher field: 'FAIRhub / California Medical Innovations Institute'
Create formatted citation field for standard reference in publications including creators, title, version, year, FAIRhub, and identifier
Add conforms_to field listing standards URIs: FAIR principles, OMOP Common Data Model, DICOM standard, mHealth standard, RxNorm, ICD-10

Populate variables field with structured variable metadata (extract from REDCap data dictionary descriptions for major domains: demographics, diabetes history, retinal imaging, lab results, vital signs, cognitive assessment, etc.)
Add is_tabular field: true for survey/clinical data; false or mixed for overall multimodal dataset
Add format and encoding fields for top-level dataset characteristics (multimodal with DICOM/CSV/mHealth mix)

Create is_deidentified class instance documenting two-tier model: public dataset de-identified (identifiers removed), controlled access dataset with sensitive identifiers (5-digit zip, race/ethnicity details, sex, genomic data, medical records)

Add participant_privacy list with privacy protection measures: (1) Two-tier access model (public de-identified, controlled with DUA), (2) Data Access Committee oversight, (3) Biospecimen access policies under development, (4) NIH data sharing policy compliance
Add informed_consent list entry with consent type (written informed consent) and process details (IRB-approved forms, all participants consented for data collection and sharing)

Add vulnerable_populations entries: (1) Racial/ethnic minority populations (Asian, Black, Hispanic) disproportionately affected by T2DM with targeted recruitment, (2) Planned tribal consultation for Native American cohort participation
Document participant_compensation if applicable (stipends, reimbursement for visit time, wearable device retention, etc.)

Create ethical_reviews list entry with IRB details: University of Washington STUDY00016228 (lead IRB), reliance agreements from UAB and UCSD IRBs, approval dates, Community Advisory Board composition and role
Add related_datasets entries linking to other Bridge2AI flagship datasets (VOICE, CM4AI, CHORUS) with typed relationships (part_of Bridge2AI program, sibling_dataset)

Add software_and_tools list extracting from acquisition and preprocessing narratives: REDCap (data management), imaging device software (Heidelberg, Topcon, Zeiss, iCare, Optomed platforms), clinical instruments (Philips ECG, MoCA Duo, Dexcom G6, Garmin Connect), analysis tools for OMOP mapping and DICOM conversion
Populate regulatory_restrictions documenting controlled access requirements for genetic data, medical records, and identifiable information; reference HIPAA applicability
Add confidentiality_level enum value based on two-tier model: public data (low confidentiality), controlled access data (high confidentiality with genetic/medical records)

Add prohibited_uses field distinguishing from discouraged_uses: (1) Commercial use prohibited for public CC BY-NC dataset, (2) Re-identification attempts prohibited (already in discouraged_uses but could be elevated), (3) Use outside data use agreement terms for controlled access data

Create version_access class documenting versioning mechanism: FAIRhub platform with version-specific documentation at docs.aireadi.org, DOI-based access (once DOI registered), version history in release notes
Add RRID if available for additional identifier support (biorepository, clinical sites, instruments)
Add anomalies field if data quality issues encountered during collection/processing (e.g., equipment failures, protocol deviations, batch effects across sites)
Document errata as issues are discovered in released versions (corrections to variables, data quality issues, protocol deviations)
Add content_warnings if any: (1) Medical imaging may contain incidental findings, (2) Genetic data sensitivity, (3) Health condition disclosure implications
Populate download_url with direct FAIRhub download link or access request URL
Add labeling_strategies if supervised labels added (e.g., diabetic retinopathy grading, disease severity classifications beyond participant-reported)
Document was_derived_from for source datasets if applicable (EHR data sources, biospecimen sources)
Add release_notes for version-specific changes beyond what's in updates field
